attributes.action: help amy &friends to receive the medical treatment that is their right to life
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Amy is 15-years-old and lives in Wirral 
Amy “might” have a rare strain of  cockayne Syndrome 
Amy is going to die young.
Not just yet, though.
The likely first step is that Amy will first go blind. 
Amy will lose her ability to walk.
After that, Amy’s limited forms of communication will cease.
 Amy won’t be able to breathe on her own
The UK’s National Health Service couldn’t or wouldn’t help Amy, and  mum Jayne approached her local newspaper, to see if they could help her to raise money to send Amy to the U.S.A
The results were  dramatic Amy has received physiotherapy and drug treatment;  
her speech has improved incredibly. She stands, still slightly stooped, but so much less than before
She can walk unaided for longer.
And she can bring her own food to her mouth with cutlery, a simple, but a near impossibility before doctors in Boston put her on a course of tablets normally taken by sufferers of Parkinson’s disease
For Amy - and for the countless other children who also need help now and for those who will come after her.LET AMY & THESE CHILDREN GET THE TREATMENT THEY NEED,THAT IS THEIR RIGHT
